  physical_appearance: \This is a sculpture that has arms
 legs
 ears
 and a head that ends with a finial. Figurative
 its eyes are implied by the two hooks. Its legs are adorned with bangles
 and its left ear has a lone blue bead dangling from the mounted ring. Though stiff and a bit flat
 it has an empty \\body\\ and thus only has its frame decorated. \

  subject_terms_1: goddesses figurative art  religious symbolism

  subject_terms_2: Religious articles  Copperwork  Sunyata  Figurative art Goddesses

  subject_terms_3: Indian sculpture/ sculpture Religion and Philosophy

  subject_terms_4: 

  sgcool_label_text: A frame
 with arms and legs
 and the head suggested by a pointed finial. Either side are pierced ears
 one adorned with an earring. It wears bracelets and large anklets. The hooks at the top of the frame are to hang a symbol representative of the deity. The frame denotes the formless transcendence of the goddess.

metadata.title_text: The Supreme Goddess as a void
metadata.physical_appearance: "This is a sculpture that has arms, legs, ears, and a head that ends with a finial. Figurative, its eyes are implied by the two hooks. Its legs are adorned with bangles, and its left ear has a lone blue bead dangling from the mounted ring. Though stiff and a bit flat, it has an empty ""body"" and thus only has its frame decorated. "

metadata.sgcool_label_text: A frame, with arms and legs, and the head suggested by a pointed finial. Either side are pierced ears, one adorned with an earring. It wears bracelets and large anklets. The hooks at the top of the frame are to hang a symbol representative of the deity. The frame denotes the formless transcendence of the goddess.
